questions.question: Where did the Central & Union Pacific railroad lines meet to complete the Transcontinental RR?
Which isn't a positive effect of the Transcontinental Railroad?
Which isn't a negative effect of the Transcontinental Railroad?

choices.answer: Native Americans were relocated to reservations
Fighting over the land was prevalent as the RR expanded
The US was able to ship goods much faster
Native Americans had a hard time keeping their traditions

questions.question: Why did many Americans move west in the years following the Civil War?
What factors led to the cattle boom in the west?

choices.answer: Open range for cattle to graze
The RR connected the open range to eastern cities

questions.question: What factors led to the end of the cattle boom and the open range?

choices.answer: No more open land, people put up barbed wire fences

questions.question: What animal did plains indians depend on?
What are the factors that led to Custer losing the Battle of Little Bighorn?

choices.answer: Gold discovered in the Black Hills
Custer didn't wait for backup & underestimated the Sioux

questions.question: Which isn't an effect relocation had on Native Americans culture?

choices.answer: Became dependent on rations and the US government
Their quality of life improved when they started farming
Traditions became hard to continue on the reservation

questions.question: What does it mean to assimilate?

choices.answer: To adopt the ways of a smaller group
To adopt the ways of a larger group

questions.question: Which isn't a way American Indians were forced to assimilate into American culture?

choices.answer: Cut their hair and change their dress
Allowed to vote in American elections

questions.question: How did Sitting Bull resist going to a reservation?

choices.answer: He willingly and peacefully went to the reservation
He fought the US, led them to victory at Little Bighorn

questions.question: How did Chief Joseph lead his people in effort to avoid going on a reservation?

choices.answer: He fought them to the death
He attempted to escape into Canada
He peacefully went to the reservation

questions.question: Which of the following isn't a problem farmers faced in the late 1800's?

choices.answer: Overproduction led to low crop prices
RR and telephone companies were charging high prices
Many farmers had debt they couldn't pay off

questions.question: Which isn’t a reason that Populists wanted the government to regulate RR & telegraph systems?

choices.answer: RR & telegraph companies were raising prices
Businesses at this time weren’t regulated by our government
All of the above are reasons why they wanted regulations

questions.question: Why did the frontier cease to exist after the 1890’s?

choices.answer: No more people wanted to move to the United States
All of the areas in the west had by this time been settled
Because the railroad stopped taking settlers west
Land was lost to Native Americans

questions.question: What was the last area of the west to be settled?
What does the A in PACED stand for?
What does the C in PACED stand for?
What does the O in TODALSS stand for?
What is an example of a primary source?

choices.answer: A story your friend told you
All could be a primary source depending on what the topic
